bcl:definition.bcl:text: appellant means an appellant as defined in section 68 of the Act;
complaint means a complaint as defined in section 39 of the Act;

disciplinary and professional conduct inquiry means a disciplinary and professional conduct inquiry under Part 6 of the Act into a report, a complaint or an investigation initiated by the commissioner under section 47 (1) (b) of the Act;
report means a report as defined in section 39 of the Act;
rules means the commissioner's rules of practice and procedure made under section 40 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Rules for disciplinary and professional conduct
inquiries and certification appeals
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 40 of the Act, the commissioner may make rules in respect of each of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disciplinary and professional conduct inquiries;
certification appeals.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The commissioner may make rules as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establishing the forms the commissioner considers advisable;
respecting notifications;
respecting setting times for any matter within the jurisdiction of the commissioner;
respecting the receipt and disclosure of evidence, including respecting the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the receipt of evidence under oath or in any other manner;
the exclusion, attendance and examination of witnesses;
the receipt of evidence from witnesses under 19 years of age;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the holding of pre-hearing conferences;
respecting setting the time and place for an oral hearing and conducting an oral hearing by telephone or other communication medium;
respecting the process for a hearing conducted by way of an oral hearing and by way of written submissions;
respecting the adjournment of hearings;
respecting the recording of hearings;
respecting access to and restriction of access to the commissioner's records or documents or a panel's records or documents;
respecting the extension or abridgement of time limits provided for in the rules;
respecting non-compliance with the rules.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The commissioner may make rules in respect of disciplinary and professional conduct inquiries, in addition to any rules the commissioner may make under subsection (1), as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the form and manner of acknowledging receipt of a complaint or report;
respecting requiring the following persons to provide an address of record for delivery and to produce records and documents:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a certificate holder who is the subject of a report, a complaint or an investigation initiated by the commissioner under section 47 (1) (b) of the Act;
a person who holds a letter of permission who is the subject of a report, a complaint or an investigation initiated by the commissioner under section 47 (1) (b) of the Act;
a person who sent a complaint to the commissioner;

a principal who sent a report to the commissioner under section 7 [report of dismissal, suspension and discipline regarding authorized persons] of the Independent School Act and the independent school authority that employs the authorized person with respect to whom the principal sent the report;
an independent school authority that sent a report to the commissioner under section 7.2 [report of dismissal, suspension and discipline regarding principals] of the Independent School Act;

a superintendent of schools who sent a report to the commissioner under section 16 [report of dismissal, suspension and discipline regarding authorized persons] of the School Act and the board of education that employs the authorized person with respect to whom the superintendent of schools sent the report;
a board of education that sent a report to the commissioner under section 16.1 [report of dismissal, suspension and discipline regarding superintendents] of the School Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting interviews conducted under section 49 (c) [additional investigation powers] of the Act;
respecting varying or rescinding a suspension under section 50 [suspension of certificate or letter of permission before hearing] of the Act;
respecting the process for preliminary reviews, investigations and consent resolution;
respecting making hearings open to the public by electronic means;
respecting the joining of citations;
respecting amendments to a citation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The commissioner may make rules in respect of certification appeals, in addition to any rules the commissioner may make under subsection (1), as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting setting the time when a certification appeal fee must be paid by an appellant;
requiring an appellant to provide an address of record for delivery;
respecting the production of records and documents by the appellant and the director of certification.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The commissioner must make public the rules.
The publication under subsection (4) may be made by posting a notice on a publicly accessible website maintained by or on behalf of the ministry.
